intro: Odina somalensis, commonly known as the Somali odina, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds. Odina somalensis is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and desert environments.
